page.title: 10THE NATIONAL TRUST
page.content: BOTH THE NATIONAL TRUST AND THE FORESTRY COMMISSION HAVE PLANTED TREES IN OUR AREA. MANY OF THESE ARE STILL VERY YOUNG AND MOST ARE EVERGREEN TREES LIKE DOUGLAS FIR AND SCOTS PINE. IN AREAS CLOSER TO THE LAKE THE NATIONAL TRUST HAS MADE EFFORTS TO PLANT BROAD LEAVED TREES AS THESE ARE THE NATURAL WOODLAND OF THE LAKE DISTRICT. ANY TIMBER WHICH IS CUT IS USUALLY USED FOR FIRE WOOD OR FENCING POSTS.THE LOWER PARTS OF OUR AREA HAVE LOTS OF DECIDUOUS TREES WHICH FORM MAGNIFICANT COLOURS IN LATE AUTUMN. THIS IS ONE OF THE ATTRACTONS TO TOURISTS IN THIS PARTS OF CUMBRIA. THE OLDEST TREES ARE PROBABLY THE YEW TREES IN THE CHURCH YARD.
